item.title: China’s bullying has Japan up in arms
item.description: The prime minister is moving quickly to establish Tokyo as a military power in the Indo-Pacific.

item.description: The perhaps 30,000 protesters who perished in Iran’s streets in early January did not die in vain.

item.description: Artificial intelligence doomer narratives reflect personal fears, not economic reality.

item.title: Germany’s chancellor sets the standard for negotiating with China

item.title: Trump’s Iran operation is the opposite of a ‘one and done’
item.description: Khamenei may be dead — but war with Iran isn’t over.

item.title: Thanks to President Trump, the hour of Iran’s freedom is at hand
item.description: Our path forward is a new constitution followed by free elections under international oversight.

item.title: Trump’s Iran gamble

item.description: Trump criticized the Iraq War. Now he’s making the same mistakes.

item.description: The Middle East is not as crucial as it was and the U.S. military is stretched thin.

item.title: A win for 11.9 million workers
item.description: Most independent contractors want the flexibility they lose when they become direct employees.
